recipe_name: Salt and pepper ‘popcorn’ prawns with tomato and chili jam
author: Jun Tanaka
programme: Chefs: Put Your Menu Where Your Mouth Is
method: For the chilli jam, heat the olive oil in a pan, add the shallots and fry for about two minutes. Add the rest of the ingredients, cook for 15 minutes and then remove from the heat to cool slightly. Blend in a food processor or blender until smooth. Pass through a sieve into a clean bowl. For the prawns, heat the oil in a large saucepan for deep frying (CAUTION: hot oil can be dangerous. Do not leave unattended.) Mix together the flours and baking powder in a large bowl. Add enough sparkling water to make a wet batter. Coat the prawns in the tempura batter and fry until lightly browned in the hot oil. Remove with a slotted spoon and drain on a plate lined with kitchen paper. Season with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Serve the prawns immediately with the chilli jam.
ingredients: dash olive oil,  2 shallots, finely sliced,  75g/2½oz caster sugar,  100ml/3½oz red wine vinegar,  3 vine tomatoes,  2 red chilli,  1 garlic clove,  vegetable oil, for deep-fat frying,  150g/5½oz plain flour,  150g/5½oz cornflour,  10g/¼oz baking powder,  sparkling water ,  480g/1lb 1oz king prawns,  salt and freshly ground black pepper
